Dupuy hadbeen authorised to tell General Weygand that, if heunfurled his flag again in North Africa, we would supporthim to the extent of six divisions with proportionableAir Force assistance and Naval aid, (The Chiefs ofStaff had felt that the allocation of such a force wasnot beyond our powers)e We would also be willing toenter into Staff Conversations to deal with thesituation in the event of the Germans attempting to occupy Tangier0Since this aide-memoire for M. It would therefore benecessary to postpone the operation of escortingmotor-transport ships through the Mediterranean until after that date.
